newsitem.title: CHINA: China shuts airport due to pager interference.
newsitem.headline: China shuts airport due to pager interference.

text.p: An airport in southern China was forced to close for nearly two hours on Wednesday because signals from pager stations were interfering with air communications, officials and state media said on Thursday.
"Our airport was temporarily closed for nearly two hours yesterday afternoon," said an airport official in the southern city of Shenzhen. He declined to give details.
However, the Shenzhen Special Economic Zone Daily nearby pager stations had interfered with channels used by air traffic controllers, forcing the two-hour closure.
The problem with the pager stations has yet to be fully resolved, it said.
The number of pagers in China's major cities has exploded in recent years, with 40 million in use nationwide by last November and millions more added each month.
Many paging companies in China have illegally used radio frequencies, sometimes causing interference in airline communications and prompting authorities to pledge a crackdown on such networks.
